## Read the Submission Directions
Please submit a PDF out using an Rmarkdown file for this task. <br><br> You may use the data set provided in this week's walkthrough or any other valid set *with citations* to address the following criteria regarding **both the 2016 and 2020 general elections**.<br><br>For each election year, do the following:

1. The differences between the popular and electoral college votes by census tract, county, and state. For each, show both the flat standard representation and where votes counts and/or percentages are displayed by size. One example of a state level representation of this, look [here](http://www-personal.umich.edu/~mejn/election/2016/){target="_blank"}.

2. How differing demographical subgroups voted. You should include at minimum *age*, *race* and *sex*^[Please use the applicable [U.S Census standard](https://www.census.gov/topics/population.html){target="_blank"} for these demographics.] and *at least three others of your choice*^[Need not be a criteria reported in the U.S. Census].

3. A *single* final visualization showing the differences in the popular and electoral college votes by *census tract*, *county*, and *state*.<br>
Please submit your output to both 

  - [eCampus](https://ecampus.wvu.edu){target="_blank"} and 

  - [Slack](https://2021edp693e.slack.com/archives/C01PTTDPTM5){target="_blank"} a `PDF` and/or `HTML` output using an Rmarkdown file for this task. 

4. Bonus! Display state^[of your choice] elections by *census tract* and *county*. 

:::
